New Records: Seth Lugo (15-8) is one win behind Detroit’s Tarik Skubal and Atlanta’s Chris Sale, who are tied for the major league lead.
Key Match Events: Tommy Pham hit his first home run for Kansas City, a tiebreaking, three-run drive in a four-run fourth inning.
José Ramírez put Cleveland ahead 1-0 in the third with a two-out bloop single.
Kris Bubic struck out the side in the eighth and Lucas Erceg worked a 1-2-3 ninth for his ninth save and sixth with the Royals.
Pre-Game Insights: Royals manager Matt Quatraro returned after missing two games following the death of his mother.
The Royals had scored three runs or fewer in six straight games, the team’s longest such streak since Aug. 15-21, 2022.
Post-Match Reflections: Quatraro said it was a relief to have someone come through.
Quatraro said it was nice to tie it up... but you’re trying to play for a big inning there.
Lugo said. “I thought I threw the ball well,” Lugo said. “I thought I was using both sides of the plate with my fastball and breaking balls and kept the hitters off balance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pham, claimed off waivers from St. Louis on Saturday, broke a 1-1 tie with his homer off Ben Lively (11-9), who allowed seven hits in four innings.
Lugo is 11-1 with a 1.40 ERA in 15 starts with four days’ rest.
The Royals closed within one percentage point of Minnesota (75-64) for the second AL wild card spot.
